column4: hey. i have a problem which seems to be pretty common..my system cant detect my cdrom
and you're sure this drive works and that the jumper settings etc. are correct?
and what kind of drive is it? make, model, internal, external?
and what, if anything, have you done so far to try to make it work?
it does, it reads CDs normally..the thing is i need to mount ISO the way it mounts cdrom to make wine recognize it
ive added /dev/sr0 to my fstab, mount point set to /media/cdrom0 which ive created
have you run dmesg | grep -i cd | grep -i rom in a terminal?
it founds it
so check that info against what is in you fstab file by: sudo nano /etc/fstab
something like dev/hdc /media/cdrom0 udf,iso9960 user,noauto 0 0
it should match the output from the dmesg check
this is what i added today /dev/sr0       /media/cdrom0   udf,iso9660 user,noauto,exec,utf8 0       0
i dont know what should match..the only similarity i see is the /dev/sr0
is this an internal or external drive
internal..."eject sr0" works
so after /dev/sr0 there's no /media/cdrom0 or something like that
forget that, I just reread your post
ok I'm at a loss. I don't know what the utf8 refers to but maybe there is someone here to knows more about this
can you please tell me how is your cdrom identified in fstab?
well, see, that's the thing... I just checked... and it's not
and my cdrom is listed in /dev not /media
if you go to the /media folder is there a cdrom drive listed there?
no it isnt..
